A80DACEE051E475CB6601976E23FE2A1.description:
Demonstrate understanding of relationships between music and the other arts,
other disciplines, varied contexts, and daily life.

0291B128BA0F47E0909B44DB06B6173D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of relationships between music and the other arts,
other disciplines, varied contexts, and daily life.

CBB1FC1964E84FC990F3F71B67A49C6D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of relationships between music and the other arts,
other disciplines, varied contexts, and daily life

BFBFFE379FB94E5AA940AFA708A67A74.description:
Relating artistic ideas and works within societal, cultural, and
historical contexts to deepen understanding.

623E9E6CBAAD447DA743F74D5DD97021.description:
Demonstrate how interests, knowledge, and skills related to personal choices and
intent when creating, performing, and responding to music

615E63AF7E2E4436A78F90BA7BF0DF6D.description:
Demonstrate how interests, knowledge, and skills relate to personal choices and
intent when creating, performing, and responding to music.

8B889B41D72D466B8F84621731DD5031.description:
Demonstrate how interests, knowledge and skills relate to personal choices and
intent when creating, performing, and responding to music.

110B4CB707724C0BA8987E5CA1753C52.description:
Synthesizing and relating knowledge and personal experiences to
create products

5475AC06D9F04B8B893498071D422B2A.description:
Describe and evaluate the ways in which critiquing others’ work and receiving
feedback from others have been specifically applied in the personal creative process.

B3484FBBE7F94320B409E207432E40A4.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of the technical and expressive aspects of selected music
and performances, demonstrating an understanding of theoretical concepts and complex
compositional techniques and procedures.

2C660A60CF074922A450CB7201DD808E.description:
Describe ways in which critiquing others’ work and receiving feedback from others
have been specifically applied in the personal creative process.

3C5344058E534E569D93FD143F22AE89.description:
Explain the effectiveness of the technical and expressive aspects of selected music
and performances, demonstrating understanding of music theory as well as compositional techniques
and procedures.

AB1879B716E94B9DB02F9B5387982AE9.description:
Describe the way(s) in which critiquing others’ work and receiving feedback from
others can be applied in the personal creative process.

F9D769E652EE45E89ACAA3CA1A772B01.description:
Describe the effectiveness of the technical and expressive aspects of selected
music and performances, demonstrating an understanding of the fundamentals of music theory.

5620250AA7F34C7EB22F4735006CFA13.description:
Develop, justify and defend interpretations of varied works, demonstrating an
understanding of the composer’s intent by citing the use of elements of music (including form),
compositional techniques, and the style/genre and context of each work.

409A4E011E534629B6F8E9780452EEC3.description:
Develop and support interpretations of varied works, demonstrating an
understanding of the composer’s intent by citing the use of elements of music (including form),
compositional techniques, and the style/genre and context of each work.

378D7CF71E91498C8D0A1DB2D4D01C05.description:
Develop and explain interpretations of varied works, demonstrating an
understanding of the composer’s intent by citing technical and expressive aspects as well as the
style/genre of each work.

377959D8CF1A4FBBB09F531ECD2B465D.description:
Analyze aurally and by reading the scores of musical works the elements of music
(including form), compositional techniques and procedures, relating them to aesthetic effectiveness,
style, mood and context. Explain how the analysis provides models for personal growth as a
composer, performer and/or listener.

AD3C723801FA49A68259D4940C9B7DFA.description:
Apply researched or personally developed criteria to select music that expresses
personal experiences and interests, visual images, concepts, texts, or storylines in moderately
complex or complex forms, and describe and justify the choice as models for composition.

A478844E38E647B5BD21EF7DB22B8A0C.description:
Analyze aurally and by reading the scores of musical works the elements of music
(including form), compositional techniques and procedures, relating them to style, mood and context.
Explain how the analysis provides models for personal growth as a composer, performer and/or
listener.

8095C91ED6E34AAC911344DEC2BD97F9.description:
Apply teacher-provided or personally developed criteria to select music that
expresses personal experiences and interests, moods, visual images, concepts, texts, or storylines in
simple or moderately complex forms, and describe and defend the choices as models for composition.

B92657AE5CE04C35A8A3BB79EEB109B3.description:
Analyze aurally and/or by reading the elements of music (including form) of
musical works, relating them to style, mood and context, and describe how the analysis provides
models for personal growth as a composer, performer and/or listener.

25D8720830FA46CB8127008FB1E9BD18.description:
Apply teacher-provided criteria to select music that expresses a personal
experience, mood, visual image, or storyline in simple forms (e.g., one-part, cyclical, binary), and
describe the choices as models for composition.

69E6AE29749E4B43A97E542F20B95CA4.description:
Explain how compositions are appropriate for a variety of audiences and contexts,
and how this will shape future compositions.

4BE94BC4E5DE467297335074081F942B.description:
Share live or recorded performances of works (both personal and others’) and
explain and/or demonstrate understanding of how the expressive intent of the music is conveyed.

03E236E2FCDA48C2841BAB9E23557E79.description:
Explain how compositions are appropriate for both audience and context, and how
this will shape future compositions.

6723967632EC4120AC2BDF19513D6DA2.description:
Share live or recorded performances of works (both personal and others’) and
explain how the elements of music and compositional techniques are used to convey intent.

F667FD3308224C81B6E99D6000D4CA11.description:
Identify how compositions are appropriate for an audience or context, and how this
will shape future compositions.

989D265D40A2468D8A8C81122A9B9603.description:
Share live or recorded performances of works (both personal and others’) and
explain how the elements of music are used to convey intent.

28CC09FAEE004099BEB39329CA065574.description:
Identify, compare and implement strategies for improving the technical and
expressive aspects of multiple contrasting works.

516F7E6A6AF44D47A54D8285D3C7B14C.description:
Using established criteria and feedback, identify the ways in which performances
use compositional techniques and convey the formal design, style and historical/cultural context of
the works.

39079825C1C044EAA10444C0B8E0C289.description:
Create rehearsal plans for works, identifying the form, repetition and variation
within the form, compositional techniques, and the style and historical or cultural context of the work.

64C02BAC78F84BF290C14EE62A95DAE7.description:
Identify and implement strategies for improving the technical and expressive
aspects of varied works.

0CC94F982C3640D2B050FDB23F4BE284.description:
Using established criteria and feedback, identify the ways in which performances
convey the formal design, style and historical/cultural context of the works.

F5E093B91AC44A918B3C6F9388792550.description:
Create rehearsal plans for works, identifying the form, repetition and variation
within the form, and the style and historical or cultural context of the work.

19F2E95AD86548F4B989449850ADB1A6.description:
Identify and implement strategies for improving the technical and expressive
aspects of multiple works.

77BD99E0E3764C0683D8F6F7423B5C7C.description:
Using established criteria and feedback, identify the way(s) in which performances
convey the elements of music, style and mood.

D63E036DE0EF44A1A4BC9F5BB2E0E3ED.description:
Create rehearsal plans for works, identifying repetition and variation within the
form.

A9B1A2D63CFC4C1F93B1A7166F5E182C.description:
Developing and refining techniques and models or steps needed to
create products.

5C1402DFBA6F4DA7B4200299AFF673A5.description:
Develop interpretations of works based on an understanding of the use of elements
of music (including form), compositional techniques, style, function, and context, explaining and
justifying how the interpretive choices reflect the creator’s intent.

F35EC426173E4DEE831F74216004E288.description:
Analyze how the elements of music (including form), and compositional techniques
of selected works relate to the style, function, and context, and explain and support the analysis and
its implications for rehearsal and performance.

0741B2E13B554A68A95EAC66D5959A0F.description:
Identify and select specific sections, movements, or entire works that express
personal experiences and interests, moods, visual images, concepts, texts, or storylines in moderately
complex or complex forms.

5F21C993CD174E57A4168DB1F99EB3CE.description:
Develop interpretations of works based on an understanding of the use of elements
of music, style, mood, function, and context, explaining and supporting how the interpretive choices
reflect the creator’s intent.

BD2C098400B24019A21FFD8DAE417BE9.description:
Analyze how the elements of music (including form) of selected works relate to the
style, function and context, and explain the implications for rehearsal and performance.

EBF6E753ADA2454DA3BEBD56DC65488E.description:
Identify and select specific passages, sections or movements in musical works that
express personal experiences and interests, moods, visual images, concepts, texts, or storylines in
simple forms (e.g., binary, ternary, rondo) or moderately complex forms.

E2CD068D66D64FA386971FA29EF513A0.description:
Develop interpretations of works based on an understanding of the use of elements
of music, style and mood, explaining how the interpretive choices reflect the creator’s intent.

035502C23CA64849A183A58134B6362E.description:
Analyze how the elements of music (including form) of selected works relate to
style and mood and explain the implications for rehearsal or performance

1CA70CC32F9F47AFACE80B3541F288CF.description:
Identify and select specific excerpts, passages, or sections in musical works that
express a personal experience, mood, visual image, or storyline in simple forms (e.g., one-part,
cyclical, binary).

735C7765E84E4DF794400EDE3B72033E.description:
Share music through the use of notation, solo or group performance, or technology,
and demonstrate and explain how the elements of music, compositional techniques, and processes
have been employed to realize expressive intent.

96914AF6D5EA4FD3B3B8CC66C20797C4.description:
Research, identify, explain, and apply personally developed criteria to assess and
refine the technical and expressive aspects of evolving drafts leading to final versions

399DB82B94954C1688BE3276F2E9AA95.description:
Share music through the use of notation, solo or group performance, or technology,
and demonstrate and describe how the elements of music and compositional techniques have been
employed to realize expressive intent.

088F31F071D34AE59A6CD045F061C1CE.description:
Identify, describe and apply selected teacher-provided or personally developed
criteria to assess and refine the technical and expressive aspects of evolving drafts leading to final
versions.

7DF72F8D9FA64D56ACF1E30C1FB0C806.description:
Share music through the use of notation, performance or technology, and
demonstrate how the elements of music have been employed to realize expressive intent.

C581C84432D94FD59C7F5B8B3711EE0C.description:
Identify, describe and apply teacher-provided criteria to assess and refine the
technical and expressive aspects of evolving drafts leading to final versions.

A83FF81BA1C740498F960ADC63020A6E.description:
Analyze and demonstrate the development of sounds and extended musical ideas in
drafts of music within a variety of moderately complex or complex forms.

6321FD235E2540FCA88891EB17EF0517.description:
Assemble and organize multiple sounds or extended musical ideas to create initial
expressive statements of selected extended experiences or abstract ideas.

2AB7C613156A41ADAB888478C1F70791.description:
Describe and explain the development of sounds and musical ideas in drafts of
music within a variety of simple or moderately complex forms (e.g., binary, rondo, ternary).

71C37650DB8B44009A4D1F04F47015C1.description:
Assemble and organize multiple sounds or musical ideas to create initial expressive
statements of selected events, memories, images, concepts, texts, or storylines

69E7A1AC64E24A96B50EC66FD83ED297.description:
Identify and describe the development of sounds or short musical ideas in drafts of
music within simple forms (e.g., one part, cyclical, binary).

E6737DCB411545D5BD6DD25EE05D7C62.description:
Assemble and organize sounds or short musical ideas to create initial expressions
of selected experiences, moods, images or storylines.

3F5D08F466AC4E25B7E18959029F8CD6.description:
Describe and demonstrate multiple ways in which sounds and musical ideas can be
used to represent extended experiences or abstract ideas.

7F237247CDEA4FEDB65579AE9A4F6192.description:
Describe and demonstrate how sounds and musical ideas can be used to represent
events, memories, visual images, concepts, texts, or storylines.

DD4370286CFC44C4ABA2F043D6E48C0F.description:
Describe how sounds and short musical ideas can be used to represent personal
experiences, moods, visual images, and/or storylines.
